nodes.documentation:
#title KIP-7 Fungible Token Standard
  Note: the KIP-13 identifier for this interface is 0x65787371.
nodes.name: IKIP7
Transfer

nodes.documentation:
#dev Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by
 a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.
nodes.name: Approval

nodes.documentation:
#notice Returns the amount of tokens in existence.
#return the total supply of this token.
nodes.name: totalSupply

nodes.documentation:
#notice Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`.
#param account An address for whom to query the balance
#return the amount of tokens owned by `account.
nodes.name: balanceOf

nodes.documentation:
#notice Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `recipient`.
#dev Throws if the message caller's balance does not have enough tokens to spend.
 Throws if the contract is pausable and paused.	

    /// Emits a {Transfer} event.
#param recipient The owner will receive the tokens.
#param amount The token amount will be transferred.
#return A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
nodes.name: transfer

nodes.documentation:
#notice Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be
 allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is
 zero by default.
#dev Throws if the contract is pausable and paused.	

    /// This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.
#param owner The account allowed `spender` to withdraw the tokens from the account.
#param spender The address is approved to withdraw the tokens.
#return An amount of spender's token approved by owner.
nodes.name: allowance

nodes.documentation:
#notice Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens.
#dev Throws if the contract is pausable and paused.

    /// IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk
 that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate
 transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race
 condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the
 desired value afterwards:
 https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

    /// Emits an {Approval} event.
#param spender The address is approved to withdraw the tokens.
#param amount The token amount will be approved.
#return a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
nodes.name: approve

nodes.documentation:
#notice Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` using the
 allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's
 allowance.
#dev Throw unless the `sender` account has deliberately authorized the sender of the message via some mechanism.
 Throw if `sender` or `recipient` is the zero address.
 Throws if the contract is pausable and paused.	

    /// Emits a {Transfer} event.
 Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.
#param sender The current owner of the tokens.
#param recipient The owner will receive the tokens.
#param amount The token amount will be transferred.
#return A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
nodes.name: transferFrom

nodes.documentation:
#notice Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `recipient`.
#dev This works identically to the other function with an extra data parameter,
  except this function just sets data to "".
#param recipient The owner will receive the tokens.
#param amount The token amount will be transferred.
nodes.name: safeTransfer

nodes.documentation:
#notice Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` using the
 allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's
 allowance.
#dev This works identically to the other function with an extra data parameter,
  except this function just sets data to "".
#param sender The current owner of the tokens.
#param recipient The owner will receive the tokens.
#param amount The token amount will be transferred.
nodes.name: safeTransferFrom

allowance(address,address).notice: #notice Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. #dev Throws if the contract is pausable and paused.	     /// This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called. #param owner The account allowed `spender` to withdraw the tokens from the account. #param spender The address is approved to withdraw the tokens. #return An amount of spender's token approved by owner.

approve(address,uint256).notice: #notice Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens. #dev Throws if the contract is pausable and paused.     /// IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729     /// Emits an {Approval} event. #param spender The address is approved to withdraw the tokens. #param amount The token amount will be approved. #return a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.

balanceOf(address).notice: #notice Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`. #param account An address for whom to query the balance #return the amount of tokens owned by `account.

safeTransfer(address,uint256).notice: #notice Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `recipient`. #dev This works identically to the other function with an extra data parameter,  except this function just sets data to "". #param recipient The owner will receive the tokens. #param amount The token amount will be transferred.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.notice: #notice Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` using the allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. #dev This works identically to the other function with an extra data parameter,  except this function just sets data to "". #param sender The current owner of the tokens. #param recipient The owner will receive the tokens. #param amount The token amount will be transferred.

totalSupply().notice: #notice Returns the amount of tokens in existence. #return the total supply of this token.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: #notice Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `recipient`. #dev Throws if the message caller's balance does not have enough tokens to spend. Throws if the contract is pausable and paused.	     /// Emits a {Transfer} event. #param recipient The owner will receive the tokens. #param amount The token amount will be transferred. #return A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: #notice Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` using the allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. #dev Throw unless the `sender` account has deliberately authorized the sender of the message via some mechanism. Throw if `sender` or `recipient` is the zero address. Throws if the contract is pausable and paused.	     /// Emits a {Transfer} event. Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance. #param sender The current owner of the tokens. #param recipient The owner will receive the tokens. #param amount The token amount will be transferred. #return A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
